data.text: Contents
Introduction

To set out the process of how GP surgeries will refer into Broomfield Hospital for an Echocardiogram, how the referrals will be triaged, how they will be booked, who will undertake the procedure and how results will be returned to requester.
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
Set out process of how GP surgeries will refer patients for an Echocardiogram.
Explain how referrals will be triaged once received and then booked.
What will happen on day of echocardiogram
How results of tests will be returned to the requester
Definitions

table_items.text: The use of ultrasound to assess a patient's heart structure and function.

data.text: Role & Responsibilities within the Trust
Ultimately the GP who refers for a Stress Echocardiogram is responsible in making sure that the referral is appropriate for the test stated with all relevant clinical information provided.
The Community Echocardiography lead is responsible for triaging referrals making sure the appropriate test is performed.
The  Cardiac  Physiologists  are  responsible  in  performing  audits  of  the  service performance.
Referral process
Referring GP's are to complete the Mid Essex community Echocardiography referral form in full and then email this form to MSE.CommunityEchoService@NHS.net
(Appendix 1)
Triage and booking process
Triaging
The MSE.CommunityEchoService@NHS.net account will be checked each morning for new referrals.
Referral forms will be checked to make sure they have been filled out correctly and contain relevant information (E.G BNP results)
Exclusion criteria
Referrals will be not be accepted for any of the following:
- Age less than 16 years
- Congenital heart disease
- Prosthetic valve assessment/assessment of severity of valve disease
- Cardiomyopathy screening
- Suspected endocarditis
- ?cardiac cause of stroke
- ?HF without raised BNP or NT-proBNP
If referral is rejected for any of the above, requesting email to be replied to suggesting cardiology referral.
Booking procedure
Once referral forms have been triaged and approved, patient will booked into next available ‘GP community echocardiogram' slot on Tomcat.
If greater than one week till appointment, letter will be sent out to the patient.
If less than one week till appointment, patient will be phoned and slot agreed. Letter still to be sent.
If referred for ‘suspected heart failure based on BNP – High levels', patient to be booked in for echo within 2 weeks.
Referral form for patient is to be attached to patient profile on TOMCAT.
Process for Echocardiogram
Competencies required:
Be fully trained in both practical and reporting aspects of Echocardiography and have current British Society of Echocardiography accreditation. (Appendix 2)
Understand  the  current  PPE  guidance  as  appropriate  to  outpatient Echocardiography and demonstrate competency in safe donning and doffing following guidelines set out by the trust.
Hold current immediate life support and be familiar with the location and layout of the resuscitation trolley.
Demonstrate a high level of communication with the patient in explaining the procedure and putting patient at ease.
Ensure  the  patient  worklist  is  uploaded  to  the  Worklist/local  on  the Echocardiography machines prior to list commencing.
Ensure the patient's details are correct including name, hospital number and
date of birth.
Clean  the  equipment  and  patient  environment  in line  with  the  current  trust guidance to reduce the risk of contamination.
Patients attending for Echocardiogram:
On the day of the appointment the patient will enter via the main entrance (atrium) where the patient will have their temperature taken and given a mask.

The patient will arrive at the Cardiac Centre (A210) and ring the bell at the front of the department. The receptionist will let them in and take their temperature. The patient will have their temperature taken again if above 37.8ºC they will be advised to return home and consult NHS 111 if concerned. If below 37.8ºC the patient will be asked to alcohol gel their hands prior to entering the department ensuring mask is worn.
The patient will be told to take a seat in the reception and they will be attended on TOMCAT.
Appointment Schedule:
Echocardiography appointments will be scheduled with a  minute appointment slot as below, this will allow for us to perform and report the test and then clean the room and equipment.
Echocardiography:
Cardiac Physiologist and Cardiographer to be present in the room for test.
The  test  will  be  performed  following  agreed  departmental  protocols  for Echocardiography (Appendix 3).
Reporting of the test will take place post-test.
The  room  will  then  be  cleaned  following  agreed  trust/departmental guidelines.

RECORD OF CLINICAL PRACTICE

table_items.text: The candidate should be able to:
Access an appropriate request form and identify the reason for the test.
Confirm the patients DOB explain the procedure to the patient and obtain verbal consent to continue.
Position the patient in such a manner that is appropriate for the test, ensuring the patient is comfortable.
Apply electrodes to produce a suitable ECG tracing.
Select the appropriate transducer and machine settings to perform the scan
Obtain all images required to fulfil the minimum data set for performing a standard transthoracic echo set by the British Society of Echocardiography (BSE).
Optimise images appropriately using the machine settings
Identify the hearts anatomy in relation to the echo images
Identify whether the LV/RV function is normal or abnormal
Identify whether there is any significant pericardial effusion
Disconnect the patient from the equipment and inform them of the departmental protocol for getting their results.
Demonstrate good understanding of cleaning of the equipment, room and good hand hygiene in line with the trusts policy for infection control
With assistance produce an accurate factual report following the BSE guidelines.

data.text: Appendix 3: Departmental scanning and reporting protocol
Echocardiogram Scanning and Report writing Protocol
Scanning

Please scan in accordance with BSE guidelines for recommended views for a standard adult transthoracic echo. Additional views maybe required as per clinical need. For specialist heart conditions such as Marfan's Syndrome please refer to specific BSE guidelines, copies of which can be found in Echo Information Folders in each Room
For patients in Atrial fibrillation (AF) please ensure at least 3 beat loops are recorded and that an average of three Doppler measurements are taken
Reporting
Please report using the EchoPac reporting system. Laminated Step-by- Step guides are located at each echoPac station for reference guides.
Please ensure clinical request details are filled in for all scans on Tomcat and on the EchoPac report.
If GP request please ensure GP name and practice address is entered in the ‘Referring Consultant' box
Please ensure physiologist name and doctors names are not abbreviated and feature the first initial and surname
Please complete all of the tabs excluding the conclusion tab at the end.
Please use the drop down selections wherever possible (if phrases need to be added please consult Kathryn Watson)

When assessing valves please consider leaflets/apparatus, excursion and regurgitation. If all are normal please tick the normal box, if not please include all sections stating which are normal and which are not.

Please include an ejection fraction on every report. If you have limited numerical data, please provide a visual estimation (even if you have to give a range, eg severe impairment <35%, moderate impairment 36-44%)

When commenting on a clinical diagnosis please use phrases ‘suggestive of' or ‘consistent with' rather than making a definitive clinical decision, e.g. mildly raised right ventricular systolic pressures suggestive of mild pulmonary hypertension

If you have not been able to see a particular area or you have been unable to measure something which is relevant to the clinical question please state this and give a reason, e.g. Unable to measure left ventricular outflow tract for aortic valve
area due to low resolution parasternal images
Always provide a summary. This should answer the clinical question and provide any other useful information. It should be factual bullet points not long essays
Please try not to abbreviate in the summaries as not all doctors/nurses understand them
All reports should be in accordance with BSE echocardiographic guidelines for chamber/valve quantification. A copy of which can be found in the echo folders in each echo room
Please ensure all reports are signed off on EchoPac and transferred/authorised on Tomcat.
Referral to Cardiologist
Please note if a patient is not under a Cardiologist a suggested referral based on the echo maybe necessary. Please use the table below:

table_items.text: Referral not suggested based on echo criteria
Send report back in normal manner, may wish to refer on clinical grounds

-LV/RV systolic dysfunction of moderate or above -Grade 3 or above diastolic dysfunction -Moderate or above valve disease -Pericardial effusion> or equal to 1cm -Suspected intra cardiac shunt -Unexplained LVH -Ascending aortic measurement >4.5cm or >4cm for Marfan's syndrome -Aneurysmal LV wall Significant LVH (>1.6cm)
Write: ‘Suggest Cardiology Referral' in summary box of report

Write: ‘ Suggest Urgent Cardiology Referral' in the summary box of report. Email results to referring clinician informing them of the report. Ideally discussed with a cardiac doctor prior to patient leaving department and an email of report sent to Cardiologist
-Post MI (VSD/severe MR/pseudo aneurysm) -Aortic dissection -Large pericardial effusion -Cardiac mass (myxoma, thrombus, vegetation)
MUST be discussed with a cardiac doctor prior to discharge. Write: ‘Suggest Urgent Cardiology Referral' in the summary box of report
